title: College Physics
description: A two-semester introductory physics book that's algebra-based, grounded with real-world examples, illustrations and explanations to help students grasp key, fundamental physics concepts.

title: College Introduction to Sociology
description: A one-semester, introductory sociology course including sociology theory and research, real-world applications, simplify and debate features, and learning objectives.

title: Biology
description: Biology is grounded in an evolutionary basis and includes exciting features that highlight careers in the biological sciences and everyday applications of the concepts at hand.

title: Concepts of Biology
description: Concepts of Biology is designed for the introductory biology course for nonmajors taught at most two- and four-year colleges. The scope, sequence, and level of the program are designed to match typical course syllabi in the market.

title: Anatomy and Physiology
description: Anatomy and Physiology is a dynamic textbook for the yearlong Human Anatomy and Physiology course taught at most two- and four-year colleges and universities to students majoring in nursing and allied health.
